oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Letter from Margaret Croft to Elise Croft from Rabun Gap
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Letter from Margaret Croft to Elise Croft, writing from the Hambidge Center for the Arts. She writes about the heavy rain, a wedding in Rabun Gap, and asks about mutual friends.

Margaret Croft took an interest in the Southern arts and crafts movement sometime after moving back to Tennessee from Cuba, and learned to weave at the Hambidge Center in Rabun Gap, Georgia. She also struck up a friendship with Mary Crovatt Hambidge, regularly corresponding with her and visiting Rabun Gap at least once a year.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Croft, Margaret, 1889-1974
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Correspondence; Rabun Gap (Ga.);
